Articles.Content:
Giblets & Co. Racing

Driver: Nico H. Kerman

(Nico Hulkenburg)
CaptainGiblets, another Nico fan hey? I guess I'll need to take Checo Kerman then.

Well which Nico, I like both, i'll have Rosberg if you want Hulkenburg

CaptainGiblets, another Nico fan hey? I guess I'll need to take Checo Kerman then.

Nah, I'll make up a name. Dave. I like.

Any news on your car? I'm experimenting with a low-drag, high-downforce car. All I can reveal is that the RCS tank is RIGHT behind the driver, and that the car has a real nose and a false nose, because without the false one, it just looks terrible.

You?

Edited February 8, 2014 by Kyrian

Mine is still just like a big go kart, lots of drag, trying to tweak things, also how to fit in the RCS, so no worries

Nah, I'll have Kamui Kerman, I like him too.

Any news on your car? I'm experimenting with a low-drag, high-downforce car. All I can reveal is that the RCS tank is RIGHT behind the driver, and that the car has a real nose and a false nose, because without the false one, it just looks terrible.

You?
My car has almost no protection for the driver, yet it has survived extensive crash-testing. It's also very slow in a straight line.

I haven't cleared mine for crashes yet, but I've done 55km of testing, and it's very responsive and pretty good in a straight line. Veers a little though. Teaser pic later, and all cars must be released after 6pm on the 7th of Feb, AEST.

In short, release your car in 26 hours from this post. Testing is allowed until then.

Kyrian Racing KR-01

Teaser image: full car will be released around this time tomorrow.
Tease us with some top speeds ^

I will give it a try. Unfortunately I'm not going to be able to do anything until 8 pm EST today.

Though I will be able to meet the deadline.

Welcome to the KSP Forums, Blaze! Glad you could join us here too Read the regulations for the vehicles and try designing the car around that. Good luck!

- Kyrian

Edit for GROOV3ST3R: KERS near empty but on, full throttle, 27.9m/s.

Edited February 7, 2014 by Kyrian
So my car didn't pass the crash test, figured out I need a totally new car. YAY ME

May I ask what failed in the crash test? If the front wing broke off, that's fine, but if your Kerbal came out of his seat then I suggest a re-design.

Try strengthening the driver's area. If you have Firespitter, use the small wire struts.
The kerb got flung 100 meters in the air, so yeah
My car will be out in 2 and a half - 3 hours.

Formula K is the ultimate racing category of Kerbal motorsport.

Then why does it use the Model M1 instead of the TR-2L?
Because, for me, the TR-2L is structurally horrendous every time I use it.

Kyrian Racing KR-01

Weight: 1.1t with 75% RCS

Top speed:

RCS empty and off: 22.8m/s

RCS near empty and on: 27.9m/s

Average cornering speed: 21m/s with RCS, 19m/s without.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited February 8, 2014 by Kyrian
Stats! Stats, eh? Statssssss, stats, staaaaaaaaaaats!!

The TR-2L is in my opinion the superior wheel - it has much better traction and requires a sturdier, lower design to keep the craft from flipping over.

However, I noticed that it also likes to artificially speed up my crafts in corners when I rapidly steer left-to-right-to-left etc. Don't know if that's due to some other game bug or if it's a purely wheel based thing but it used to happen in my old BOXX-CART.

That said, I think I can come up with something that will be a winner this time round as well ^

Aurora Motorsports DX-9

Never done an imgur before... hope it works!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

So yea I kinda find it ugly... However it meets all the criteria!

Edited February 7, 2014 by Blaze 9X
Being a noob...
Giblets & Co Racing G&C T1 will be shown off tomorrow at 1:00 EST

Blaze 9X, I see your RCS tank. Genius.

Also, it's not that ugly. Google: Toro Rosso STR9, then you'll see what ugly is.

And the imgur album works, don't worry about that! Good luck!

CaptainGiblets, I'm excited! Can't wait!

[EDIT] I've been looking at our two cars and I can't help but notice the huge design difference. I guess you've gone for a low CoM, mid CoL and good driver protection, whereas I've gone for a low-mid CoM, low CoL and as light as possible while still keeping Dave safe.

Edited February 8, 2014 by Kyrian

Yea... the STR9 makes mine look like a masterpiece.

Edited February 8, 2014 by Blaze 9X

That RCS tank - it looks good as a counterweight but it's horrible for your aerodynamics. + if you use up your RCS, you lose the balance advantage. Might want to rethink that and slam the entire car closer to the ground instead.

I present the GCR T1

Weight 2.25 tons

Edited February 8, 2014 by CaptainGiblets
